sentences: Hakkasin end tundma kuidagi alaväärsemina kui need, kes kandsid saapaid.
Ma hakkasin tööd hommikul kell kaheksa.
Ta hakkaks meile aitama, kui me palume.
context: The word 'hakkasin' is the 1st person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'hakata', which means 'to begin' or 'to start'. It's used when someone starts doing something in the past. In the provided dictionary example, it appears to be part of a longer phrase where 'hakkasin' indicates the beginning of feeling inferior after someone else's actions.
